commitResults.messageBody:
Project starts with a basic skeletal version.

Let's allow BLARB, which is this version of Duke to greet the users
and exit when called, and to echo all other unrecognized commands.

The skeletal version is to kick off the project without complications.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add comments and change variable names
commitResults.messageBody:
Increase clarity on the functionality of the code.

Variable names are changed to fit the problem statement.

BLARB should store and list text inputted by the user.

Edit the echo utility into storing the inputted text.
Add listing utility to call stored text.

Such utility is used to later further implement other functions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement ability to mark tasks as done
commitResults.messageBody:
Allow stored tasks to function as checklist.

Converted storage from Strings to self-defined immutable class Task.

This is so that the completion attribute is bundled with the task,
rather than separately denoted.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for different types of Tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
There are different types of tasks and their properties
should be taken into account.

Created three subtypes of Task. Changed Task to a mutable
class and allow toggling of the completion status.
Parsing of the input strings by split() is implemented.

The immutable state of the Task class is undesirable
for inheritance. Parsing method is made to fit the
command-description style of input.

commitResults.messageTitle: Abstract chat functions to a separate class
commitResults.messageBody:
The Duke class is messy and not written in an object-oriented style.

Abstracted all chatting functions to new class so that the Duke
class only does the logo printing and input looping.

The main class is made cleaner and the chatting functions are
rewritten in OOP style to clear the code and enhance readability.

Shell script testing is used to faster debug the code.

Created test case and fixed minor bugs in the output in order to
decrease issues in the shell script, namely, the spaces at the end
of output lines are deleted.

Spaces at the end of a line cause comparability issues, and causes
the shell script to fail test cases even if outputs are the same.

The code should have more flexibility for the acceptance of exceptions.

Various try-catch blocks are added to catch different exception types
and to give different responses according to.

The use of Java inbuilt exceptions are used directly rather than self-
defined ones are due to the inbuilt exceptions being sufficient for
the current exceptions that may be caught.

The user should be able to delete tasks that are no longer needed.

A delete function is added to the code. Some Integer types are changed
to int types.

The conversion of reference types to primitive types is implemented
in order allow easier deletions in ArrayLists.

The commands in the Blarb class is implemented through a long
if-else if-else block, while switch-case blocks would allow cleaner
code.

The enum type for commands are created, and the long if-else if-else
block in Blarb.java is replaced with a switch-case.

The enum type is used in order to allow for the switch-case block to
be used as it only accepted single variable types.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add values to enum type Command and reformatted code
commitResults.messageBody:
The Command class is still dependant on a long if-else is-else block.

String values are attached to each Command.
Cleaned code to fit Java coding standards.

Commands can be called directly from the input string rather than
going through a long selection block.
